title: Zone 2 Exercise and Training
content: Zone 2 exercise and training was discussed. This was originally recorded as an Instagram Live in March 2021. To learn more about zone 2 training, listen to our episode with a Ph.D. and AMA #19: Deep dive on Zone 2 training, magnesium supplementation, and how to engage with your doctor.

title: Understanding Zone 2 Exercise
content: Zone 2 exercise is a type of workout that focuses on maintaining a specific heart rate zone. The benefits of Zone 2 exercise include improved cardiovascular health and increased endurance. It is beneficial for individuals of all ages. Zone 2 exercise can be measured using a lactate meter, or by monitoring heart rate. The range for Zone 2 can change over time as fitness levels improve.

title: Zone 2 Exercise and Nutrition
content: The timing of meals in relation to Zone 2 exercise can impact performance and results. It is also possible to use supplements, such as UCAN, to enhance the benefits of Zone 2 exercise.

title: Zone 2 Exercise and Other Workout Types
content: Zone 2 exercise can be combined with other types of workouts, such as High Intensity Interval Training (HIIT) or Functional Threshold Power (FTP). It can also be performed on various devices, including bikes, treadmills, and rowers. Swimming can also be used for Zone 2 exercise.

title: Monitoring Zone 2 Exercise
content: A lactate meter can be used to measure if an individual is in Zone 2 during a workout. Lactate levels can be checked post-workout to assess performance. Wearable devices may have different definitions of zones, so it's important to understand how each device measures and defines these zones.

title: Zone 2 Exercise and Health Metrics
content: Zone 2 exercise can increase Heart Rate Variability (HRV), which is a measure of cardiovascular health. It can also impact body composition and glucose disposal, which can contribute to overall health and longevity.

title: Additional Aspects of Zone 2 Exercise
content: There are different zones of exercise, including Zone 1 and Zone 5, each with their own benefits and considerations. Zone 2 exercise can also be impacted by factors such as lactate thresholds and functional thresholds. Hot and cold therapy may also enhance the benefits of Zone 2 exercise.
